Allewaert]] Vice President, Chief Financial Officer, [[Mike Albanese]] Executive Producer, [[Todd Leonard]] SVP & CIO | products = [[Blaster Learning System]] | num_employees = 296<ref>{{cite web |title=Davidson & Associates Inc · 10-Q · For 3/31/96 |url=http://www.secinfo.com/drdbh.91uf.htm#6thPage }}</ref> | parent = [[All American Television]] (1989-1991), [[Thorn EMI]] (1992-1996), [[Cendant|Cendant Corporation]] (1996) | sub = [[Golden Books Interactive]]<br>[[Davidson and Associates|Davidson/Simon and Schuster]] }} '''Davidson & Associates''' (or simply '''Davidson''') was an [[educational software]] company headquartered in [[Torrance, California]].<ref>"[http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=331136 Davidson & Associates]." ''[[BusinessWeek]]''. Retrieved on June 1, 2010.</ref> It was best known for the [[Blaster Learning System|Blaster]] series, including Math Blaster and Reading Blaster. In 1995, Davidson released 3D Jungle Train for Windows 95 based on new 3D software in which the player had to find a lost diamond and would be rewarded with a video adventure to other parts of the jungle. Bob and Jan Davidson sold the company in the early 1990s and founded the [[Davidson Institute for Talent Development]]. In 1989, Bob Davidson became Chairman and CEO of Davidson and Associates, Inc. Jan Davidson continued her role as President focusing on building the product development side of the business. In the next few years, Bob formed strategic partnerships with [[Fisher Price]], [[Simon & Schuster]], [[Kaplan, Inc.]] and made several strategic acquisitions, including [[Blizzard Entertainment]] who had by that time produced their first major hit ''[[Warcraft]]''.{{Citation needed|date=October 2007}} In 1996, the company was acquired by [[CUC International]] and merged with another large educational software company, [[Knowledge Adventure]] best known for its [[JumpStart]] series of educational games. ==References== <references /> ==See also== {{Portal|Greater Los Angeles|Computing|Companies}} * [[Davidson Academy of Nevada]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Davidson and Associates}} [[Category:Defunct software companies of the United States]] [[Category:Defunct software companies]] [[Category:Educational software companies]] [[Category:Companies based in Los Angeles County, California]] [[Category:Defunct companies based in California]] [[Category:Companies based in Torrance, California]] {{US-videogame-company-stub}} {{BlizzardEntertainment-stub}}
